review_content:
A small bottle from Legacy Liquor in Vancouver.
A black beer with modest white head, roasted malt nose, roasted malt palate. An acceptable run o’ the mill dark lager.
Blik geprobeerd op vakantie. Het is een donkerbruin bier met een wat rode gloed en een stevig beige schuim. Het heeft een moutige geur. De smaak is moutig, licht bitter en wat wrang.

Maybe the most accessible dark lager on the market. Price trends a little too high for what I think it's worth but tastes appropriately dark and appearance is equally dark. Personally, dark lager and ale sits in a weird place where I think it would've been better to drink a stout or a porter at the time instead. Not something I'd pick up regularly but not bad either.

Beer Number From Brewery: 3

Container Type: Bottle

Date Drank: 5 February 2020

Purchase Location: Liquorland

Aroma: Slightly smokey

Appearance: Big deep tan head above a dense looking black beer

Flavour: Malty, bitter

Mouthfeel: Smooth

Comments: I bought this beer on a whim and expected to be anything other than what it was. Much to my surprise this beer was good - very good - and it is a beer that I would drink again.

Pours: very dark caramel. Not a lot of head at all carbonation: very light
Nose: very mild chocolate and caramel on the, 
Flavour: what little taste there is has notes of caramel and copper. Pretty ordinary, very easy drinking.

22.08.2019, 0,35l can @ hotel room at Narita Airport:

Nice bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry roasted, hay, weeds, minerals, roasted grain, bark, toast, popcorn, soil, hints of licorice. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, minerals, paper, hay, soil, hints of roasted grain and licorice. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and harsh metallic mouthfeel. So boring.

Deep dark brown coloured body that does look almost black, all with a very nice, strong two to three centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, nuts, oatmeal, prunes and a touch of raisins. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong roasted malt and oatmeal flavours dominate with a light cream and lactose note and a touch of nuts and earthiness coming towards the end, but the flavours and malt are quite smooth with no sort of alcohol flavours at all. Aftertaste shows the roasted malt, deep oatmeal and lactose notes with creaminess and a touch of caster sugar towards the end, but the dry flavour and mouthfeel remain, making this quite easy-to-drink and fairly one-dimensional throughout. Overall, a fairly nice beer that to me, drinks  as a dry stout, so to have this have ale like flavours and complexity, especially on the malt perspective, while being a lager is an extremely positive thing. I sampled this 350 mL blue can purchased a few minutes ago from World Liqour Mart (YaMaYa?) in Daimon, Tokyo, Japan on 05-August-2019 for 267JPY sampled in my hotel room here in Tokyo, Japan, on 05-August-2019.
The beer is called Schwarzbier, but its not like the German Schwarzbier. With the chocolate and coffee hints, the beer tends to a Porter. Nice and drinkable.
Honestly one of the best tasting dark beers I have ever had. On its say definitely rivals Guiness for taste
334ml embossed bottle. Pours a cola color, light tan head. Aroma is metallic raisin. Flavor is bready, light roast, relatively inoffensive, some raisin. Thin and watery palate.
Bottle. Unattractive bread aroma. Sweet malts with no roastiness to reign it in or give it any interest. Will use the next one to cook beef ribs in.

A can from Welcome in Muzha. Aroma: sour. Appearance: opaque cola, minimal head. Palate: light-bodied and rather thin, predominantly bitter finish. Taste: medium bitter, coffee, roasted flavours, burnt toast. Drinkable, pretty good value for money.

Nose: some roast malt, some caramel, very little coffee. Basically a very light dark beer.

Taste: light maltiness, some sweetness, very little coffee bitterness. Very light body, thin texture with lively carbonation.

Finish: short bittersweet.

Entry dark beer for people that doesnt like much bitterness with their dark beer? Well at least it’s drinkable.

Sampled on draught at a Japanese restaurant in Taipei. Near black with a beige head. Very light with little flavour. Some carbonation and extremely slight bitterness. It’s amazing that it is possible to create a beer with so little flavour.

Can from Japanese supermarket. Very dark brown beer with some clarity. Nose is light roasted malt, light burnt, light chocolate, light coffee, barley grain malt, lager yeast, light fruity, metallic. Taste is light barley grains, bitter hop, dry lager yeast, slight chocolate, roasted grains, slight fruity and light coffee bean. Slight metallic.

A small bottle from Legacy Liquor in Vancouver.
A black beer with modest white head, roasted malt nose, roasted malt palate. An acceptable run o’ the mill dark lager.
Blik geprobeerd op vakantie. Het is een donkerbruin bier met een wat rode gloed en een stevig beige schuim. Het heeft een moutige geur. De smaak is moutig, licht bitter en wat wrang.

Maybe the most accessible dark lager on the market. Price trends a little too high for what I think it's worth but tastes appropriately dark and appearance is equally dark. Personally, dark lager and ale sits in a weird place where I think it would've been better…
Beer Number From Brewery: 3 Container Type: Bottle…

Pours: very dark caramel. Not a lot of head at all carbonation: very light Nose: very mild chocolate and caramel on the, Flavour: what little taste there is has notes of caramel and copper. Pretty ordinary, very…
22.08.2019, 0,35l can @ hotel room at Narita Airport: Nice bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry roasted, hay, weeds,…

Deep dark brown coloured body that does look almost black, all with a very nice, strong two to three centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, nuts, oatmeal, prunes and a touch of raisins. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong roasted malt and oatmeal flavours…
The beer is called Schwarzbier, but its not like the German Schwarzbier. With the chocolate and coffee hints, the beer tends to a Porter. Nice and drinkable.
Honestly one of the best tasting dark beers I have ever had. On its say definitely rivals Guiness for taste
334ml embossed bottle. Pours a cola color, light tan head. Aroma is metallic raisin. Flavor is bready, light roast, relatively inoffensive, some raisin. Thin and watery palate.
Bottle. Unattractive bread aroma. Sweet malts with no roastiness to reign it in or give it any interest. Will use the next one to cook beef ribs in.

A can from Welcome in Muzha. Aroma: sour. Appearance: opaque cola, minimal head. Palate: light-bodied and rather thin, predominantly bitter finish. Taste: medium bitter, coffee, roasted flavours, burnt toast. Drinkable, pretty good value for money.
Nose: some roast malt, some caramel, very little coffee. Basically a very light dark bee…

Sampled on draught at a Japanese restaurant in Taipei. Near black with a beige head. Very light with little flavour. Some carbonation and extremely slight bitterness. It’s amazing that it is possible to create a beer with so little flavour.

Can from Japanese supermarket. Very dark brown beer with some clarity. Nose is light roasted malt, light burnt, light chocolate, light coffee, barley grain malt, lager yeast, light fruity, metallic. Taste is light barley grains, bitter hop, dry lager yeast, slight chocolate,…
Dark beer, light taste. Almost black.in colour with a thin head. Light sweet aroma. Dry and drinkable. More interest than lager. Reasonable.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji na potrzeby usupełniania profilu.
On tap at Asahi tower in Tokyo. Light, dry dark beer. Called extra cold for some reason.  Lots of carbonation provides most of the excitement.

350 ml can in Japan on Yakushima Island. 
Pours with a very dark brown body. 
Medium+ body and near medium carbonation. 
Mild bitterness; moderate strength for style; some light spicy hops but dark roasted grains dominate; 
Flavor: a decent Japanese schwarzbier.

dark brown colour, moderate sized beige head; aroma of unripe plum, berriess and slight apple, toasted rye bread notes, and some minimal burnt notes;taste is also dominated by unripe fruity-sourish notes with some dark chocolate and toaste rye bread notes; well, not a masterpiece
Near black with a thin tan head. A bit of sweet cocoa, caramel malt, light vanilla cream, light toffee. Medium but light body. Finish is sweet and then dry. Not so bad.
BTBF 2018. Dark brown color. Tan head. Dry malty aroma. Grains with low chocolate notes. Sweet malt flavor. Low grains with an easy finish. Fairly smooth.

Not so strong 
As everybody says 
Dark Anahi super dry
Little bit rare one even in Japan
Not so many places offer this bottle

334ml Bottle from Kujiraya, Shibuya, Tokyo (¥450):

This one was a fairly enjoyable offering from Asahi & a nice change from the usual pale lagers I was drinking with dinner most nights in Japan, this one was lively & fresh with a slightly dry feel at the end. There was plenty of roasted & dark malts throughout with some grains, hay & grassy hops working well together to help this one go down easily enough.
Schwarzes Bier schaum Ok, kaum Geruch etwas malz, sehr wässriger Geschmack etwas malz leichte röstnoten süß, ne brauch ich nicht
0,33lDose auf Guam. Unser letztes Bier hier? Schwarzes Bier. Brauner Schaum. Wenig Aroma. Malz, Melasse, Karamell. Geschmack etwas Kork und Holz, dann verbrannter Karamell und Malz. Recht flach.
Draught @ Mount Takao Beer Mount, Tokyo. Okay, slightly sweetish and earthy dark lager with hints of roastiness.

Can. Very dark brown, small to average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Light to moderate, malty lightly sweetish, faint caramel and hoppyness. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint caramel and fruitiness, faint hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish, faint caramel and, light hoppyness. Bit thin - lacks character. Schwarz for meek masses.
500ml mostly blue can from Metro, Xiamen. Pours black with thin off white head. Aroma of roast malt. Sweetish taste.

Tastes quitlike heavily of adjuncts with a roastiness, malty at the end. Not much to it. Nothing complex or memorable. Definitely not a stout, or a "Japanese Guinness" as sometimes marketed. It’s a dark lager.

A deep, ruddy-hues brown/black with a small but lasting light tan head. Roasty malts, coffee, choc, liquorice. Light to medium body, medium carbonation and a soft to moderate length and intensity malt bitterness to finish.

Dark brown color with a beige, short lived head. Mild roasted malt scent with hints of wet cardboard and unsweetened baking cocoa. Flavor is a blend of a cola and slightly burnt toast, some sweetness from the malts, bits of over roasted coffee bean. Thin body. This is the best of the recent "Convenience store" beers that I picked up, but that really isn’t saying much.
Can. Dark brown color with tiny tan head. Aroma - Lightly roasted, malt. Taste - Bittersweet, malt, water, hops.
Can sample at a tasting at troubles place. Thanks tomer. Dark brown. Malt, caramel, toast, light roast, sweet, faint bitterish note, light to medium-bodied, faint alcohol not.

shared at a tasting, thanks Dudu, stble, slightly dense bubbly head, quite clear very dark brown color, aroma of dark bread with hints of metal and biscuit, flavor of dark bread, mtal, caramel and a hint of honey, light to medium btterness. Fair and drinkable.
At Dror’s place, pours brown with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, cola, flavor of malt, roasted malt, medium bodied

33 cl can at the container, Singapore. 
Pours black with little head. Sweet caramel aroma with sugary caramel and malty taste. Refreshing.
334ml from bottle at the Hare and Tortoise. Dark and very carbonated lager. Weak in aroma, and slight metallic aftertaste

334 ml bottle, from Vinmonopolet, Nettbutikken. ABV is 5.5%. Black colour, large beige head. Aroma of dark malts and dark bread. Dry flavour, moderate roast malts, very moderate hops. Nice enough to drink, but not particularly remarkable.
KØLF 041116. Dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma is apple, roasted malt. Flavor is roasted malt, apple, yeast, caramel. Medium body. Ordinary beer.
Dry with nice balanced flavour between roasted malt and faint hops. Not great, but I do not mind it.

Bottled (backlog). Deep brown colour, close to black, with a mediumsized off-white head. Aroma is roasted malts, some dried fruits, mild herbs and wood. Flavour is quite similar, but also has a quite strong syrupy sweetness to it.

F: big, creamy, white brown, good retention.
C: dark brown to cola colour, clear.
A: malt, hint of roasted tones, molasses, chocolate, citrus.
T: malt, hint of citrus, chocolate, roasted malt, cacao, dry grassy bitterness on the palate, light to medium body, medium carbonation, not bad but nothing to be remember, 500ml can from E-Mart near Incheon airport in Seoul.

On tap. A straightforward dark lager with toasty caramel malts to the fore and a low hop bitterness at the finish. Light-medium body with a sweet flattish palate. Better than the regular Super Dry but that’s not saying much.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown black color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted malty caramel aroma. Slightly roasted malty caramel flavor. Has a slightly roasted malty caramel finish.

Bottle. Pours black with a thin brown head subsiding average quick. Scent is some sort of ale yeast and a bit musky. Taste is dense caramel and notes of dark fruit, but otherwise fairly sugary beer. Finish is a bit sticky but not too bad. Good.
Ok. Just basically like a darker version of the regular Asahi Super Dry. Certainly better schwarzbiers out there.

334 ml bottle. Clear, dark amber body with a medium sized beige head. Aroma has roasted, dark malt with caramel. Flavor is medium sweet, dark, light roasted malt, low bitterness. Clean, quite plain black lager. Nice Shweartzbier and pleasant within its style.
Bottle.Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, some roasted notes and yeast. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel and fruitiness. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Cola colour with nice lasting foam. Aroma is weak. Mostly roasted, licorice and some chocolate. The same in the taste, witch also is weak. Not impressed.

On bottle from Systembolaget in Strømstad.
black/ dark brown color - good offwhite foam. Medium aroma intensity; malty,
Lightly roasted and some dried fruits and fruitiness. Medium body & complexity. Some immediate sweetness, good balancing bitterness. Enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

334ml bottle BB 1/2017 from Tokyo Liquor Newmarket.
Malty aroma.
Black color with tan head.
Very mild bitterness with smooth sweetness and thin finish.
Not bad though.

Canned 350ml. -Darker brown (cola) coloured, medium sized off-white head, dusty caramel nose. Light roasted malt, caramel, bread and cane sugar with mild mild touch of chocolate in the finish. Pretty flat.

Dry, czyli wytrawne. Sadzilem ze bedzie jednak slodkie i ze to sciema. Ale, ale nawet ciut bylo wytrawne, piana srednia i srednio trwala. dosc ciemna barwa z licznymi przeswitami czerwieni. Karmelowe, zarazem delikatne piwo, malo slodowe, taka slodkosc jak z ciasteczek oreo. z podpalonym cukrem. Ale pewna doza wytrawnosci io goryczki takze bylo. Zwlaszcza na zakonczenie. Ogolnie sredniak
Clear very dark brown with little brown head. Aroma is licorice, dark chocolate, dust, sour corn. Taste is more dust, a watery bitterness, some soapy sourness. Soapy finish. Ugly.

50 cl can from a convenience store in Seoul, Korean import. Dark cola color, almost black with a deep red hue. Big beige head, lacing, good looking. Light aroma of toasted malts, starch, dust. Taste is moderately bitter, partly sourish, soft to average carbonation, light body, smooth texture, dry finish (nonetheless!), clean, crisp, a little woody. Liked.
On tap at Eleven Rooftop Bar. Not as bad as I’d expected, the finish was dry and it lacked any sweetness, mild roasted flavours.
Bottle, 5.5%. Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, bread and hop. Flavour is malt, caramel, bread, little thin, medium sweet, hop, notes of liquorice and a little bitter.

(Bottle) Pours black with red hints and thin loose tan head. Modest aroma - hints of nuts and cardboard. Light bodied and fizzy. Unremarkable taste - some toffee sweetness with some vague dark roast toasty hints. Drinkable.

Bottle. Clear dark brown with a light tan head. Aroma is pretty shy, but there’s some nuts, cocoa and caramel. Thin. taste has some licorice too. There’s a bit more flavour than expected after the very modest aroma. Low bitterness. Is dry at the end. A bit empty, but mostly dull.
Klares dunkelbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, etwas Karamell, Röstaromen, brauner Zucker.
Drunk from can, very mild aroma, slightly sweet slight licorice. Tastes of licorice, very mild toffee and a slight roastiness. Just an average beer.

Overall: Sweet fruits, oranges.
Note: Bottle 334 ml at Raw Sushi & Grill. Reviewed 2016-04-23.

BB 05.2016. Poured a dark red-brown with a ruby edge tint and a two-finger light tan head that diminished slowly and laced OK. Carbonation low to moderate and medium sized bubbles. Aroma slightly of caramel malt. Taste slightly of caramel malt with a hint of roasted grain; low bitterness. Light body, a bit thin. Clean and dry with a slightly sweet finish.

Draft at Harrys Bar, Boat Quay, Singapore. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is light roasted malt, liqourice. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter sweet with a rich think creamy light hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Found this at a Chinese restaurant in Melbourne. Dark brown with a full head. Aroma is a bit cocoa-toasty, as typical of the better big brewery dark lagers. Softer body, light chocolate.
a little bitter in the finishing, pleasant dark brown, slightly watery in the first mouth
Can. Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are light roasted malts and that’s about it. Better than any lager but not great.
(can) clear, dark brown with a tall brown head; aroma of dough, then hint of roast; watery palate; watery flavour with a light bitter finish; worse than expected
Dry slightly bigger finish. Nice wetness on the tongue. Not too complex, could this be a dark lager? Tastes kind of like a bland stout that’s been thinned with seltzer water.

Radiant, deepest ruby with an off-white, drabby foam atop that laces well. Sulphury, eggy fart ensued by notes of boiled cabbage with just a hint of topsoil and peat. Tastes a lot better than it smells. Moss, earth, soft green herb and nut husks. No bitterness. Light sugars to the front with a touch of rust on the swallow. Chalky feel with a light body. Drinks with alarming ease but there’s nothing here to make it bounce. (33,4cL, BBE 10/15, Thirsty Camel, Ellenbrook)

Appearance: Tan foam, clingy. Dark beer. Nose: Some malt, sweetness, jam. Taste: a bit light and watery. Coffee and toast. PalateL smooth, dry, good balance. Overall: An acceptable big brewer black beer.
330ml can. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Roasted malts aroma. Taste is roasted malts and brown sugar. Very light and similar to regular Asahi. Bit of a lame attempt at a dark beer.
334ml bottle into glass. Dark ruby red beer with thin tan head. Slight slight malt nose. Watery flat mouthfeel with mild sweet nutty finish. Disappointing and not one I will be revisiting.
Bottle. Black, minimal head, white foam, lightly bitter, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, & astringent finish.

on tap In Osaka. Little of the desired subtle dark flavours you should find in a schwarzbier. pretty ordinary. only slightly more flavour than the usual super dry. but look, it?s good for washing down your food, which is how you usually drink beer in japan. go for the suntory premium malts black instead if you want a schwarzbier.
Can from Yamaya, Hitachinaka, Ibaraki, Japan. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium off white/beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, chocolate.

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a dark cola brown with a sudsy tan head that dissipates pretty quickly. Aromas of raisins, caramel and citrus but all very light. Taste is light caramel and roast with a bit of a citrus zing. Very dry - as promised. Clean finish with a little fruit in the aftertaste.

Pours quite dark, almost black, with a reddish glow against the light. Frothy pale tan head that lasts a few minutes. Nose is roasted malt and a hint of molasses. Taste is sweet. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Not bad at all.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours very dark with a nice lingering frothy head, faint malty caramel aroma, taste is mild & blended well with a dry bitter finish
Taste nearly like a standard Asahi Super Dry with black food coloring. The only discernible difference would be that the Dry Black is slightly less sweet.
Deep brown, almost black pour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma is roasty, coffee, grain. Taste is very watery - a little of the roastiness, a little sweet, but really just thin and bland

Bottle at Tanuki’s cave on Queen St. Pours dark with frothy head. Aroma of roasted malts. Very drinkable. Sweet caramel taste, dry and well rounded chocolate nectar. Sort of has a tinge of pineapple in the aftertaste.

0.334l bottle @ Umami. Looks as you’d expect, black there in the glass, a light foamy grey head on top. The nose is what I would describe as soft. Some thin chocolate and roasted dry malts. Other than that I can’t really say that I get anything from this. Taste is just the same really. Feels light oily on the mouthfeel with an average carbonation level. Dry, slightly sweet and roasted with hints of coffee. Not to memorable at all this one. The food however! 11.01.2014

350 ml can bought at YATA in Grand Century Place, Mong Kok.



Clear deep blackish brown colour; Less than one-quarter finger head and residual soapy beige foam which fades in 10 seconds; Moderate sticky lacing and minimal carbonation; Slightly fragrant aroma of roasted malt, with light caramel, light black coffee, toffee, Cola, light sugar and thin grass; Mid to light sweet taste of thin roasted malt, with nuts, strong rice, light toffee, black coffee, Cola, very light lemon, bitter hops and strawy grass; Close to light body. Thin but slick palate; Mouth feel is seriously rice-thinned black Lager - actually good maltyness in a rather slick and not so thin body, strongly roasted and nutty. Loads of rice but quite smooth throughout, not the raw grainy stuff from those cheapo macro Pales. Notable light black coffee and caramel fill up the palate. No sweetness, not very ‘Dry’. Close to the Schwarz style but very dour and lacking. Hmm… Hoppiness is thin grass in nose, light lemon and strawy grass in taste. Bitterness was moderately strong for a lasting,
light astringent finish; Fairly dry after taste; Roasty and light bitter to mouth.



Comments: This one feels like the regular Super Dry with dark malt as direct replacement. It more or less emulates the light black beer quite well, albeit artificially because of the rice. Not as dry and crisp as the Super Dry proper, it still worth a chug for a relaxing evening. Just okay and easy.
Lata de 50 cl, adquirida en un Circle K de Nagoya, Japon. Color marron oscuro. Sabor a malta, muy ligeramente tostado. Muy poco cuerpo.

Can from the hotel in Tokyo 

Clear dark brown with a medium sized tan head, good lacing. Mild aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Flavors of dark malts, toffee, coffee with a dry finish 

Decent
delikatny, słodowy lekko palony zapach. ciemnobrązowe, przejrzyste ze słabą pianą. w smaku lekko palone i miodowe.

Clear dark beer, right carbonation with small beige head. The aroma has some earthy, leaves, chocolate and a slight cereal notes. The flavor is almost absent, a little of malt, but that’s it, light body, watery feeling, and almost nothing aftertaste, far away to be a good Schwarzbier

From a can in Narita, Japan. Pours dark, nearly opaque, black with a thin beige head that dissipates quickly. No real lacing on the glass. Aroma is faint and includes roasted malts. Taste is slightly sweet with roasted malts. No hops to speak of. Good carbonation. Thin mouthfeel.

very dark brown with a white head. smell is mild, some malt. taste is of malt, very little roast. some caramel sweetness, sweetness is only countered with astringency rather than bitterness. carbonation is strong and harsh. poor crap, a typical east asian "black beer"

Pours two fingers of foamy tan head on a black body.
The aroma has an attempt at roasted malt... but has a mostly dry grain smell.
The taste has some roasted malt notes, mellow sweetness throughout but not overpowering. Retains a good balance.
The texture is smooth and lighter with lower carbonation.
An easy drinking black beer.

350 ml can from Maruetsu. Was looking for something interesting but they didn’t really have much choice, so decided to try this one out. Pours actually nice, pitch black with a foamy, beige and long-lasting head. Leaves some nice lacing on a glass as well. I was expecting to get some roast in the aroma but nope - it is actually surprisingly fruity and fresh. I get something synthetical only when I sniff it third time. Taste… well it’s not so special. If I had blind-tasted it, I wouldn’t have been able to tell this beer is dark. It has carbonation, moving on to some sweet malt character and dry aftertaste. Something synthetic in the background. I’d like to know what was the brewer thinking when he decided to brew this one. Maybe something like this: "Why don’t I make a beer that tastes like Asahi Super Dry but looks dark?". It is a bit better than your usual Asahi - but only marginally so.

Can from the convenience store. Drunk from the can, a thin to medium body & a roasty malt aroma. The taste has some mild coffee & chocolate notes. Better than I expected but it is just a toned down schwarzbier. An alright choice if you’re stuck buying from a konbini.

Can. Clear, sparkling, brownish black color, long-life small sized light beige head, dried plummy and roasted woody aroma, light dry body, too fizzy, sweet oily taste, dry fizzy and watery palate with dry hoppy and roasted notes.

Draft to glass at Asahi Osaka served at regular temp. 
Blackberry and toasted malts. Deep brown with a creamy tan head. Taste is bland, not much going on here.

Draft at brewery - Very light roast malt, may also be me wishing for it. Actually a bit of black current. A bit of roast and again that dark berry sweetness. Thin and better than the lager, but not a real dark of any sort.
Three finger head. Don’t let the color fool you, this tastes exactly like an asahi pilsner. It’s slightly sweet in a way that reminds me of the kirin "stout"
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~
Soap smell, touch of roasted malt. Mild chocolate flavor, not much else, annoying bitter dry finish. Maybe a tad better than the lager version, but still pretty miserable.

Bottle, from my local Korean grocery store. 
Nice black coca cola colour, darker than coke, with a mentionable creamy head, with lots of bubbles. Aroma of plums, very weak, with bourbon and some sour note. Flavour of...nothing. Very insipid. It does have a bit of a roasted malt note and some carbonation. All else is water. Still, it is very different from anything that I have tasted that falls into this category, except perhaps for Beerlao Dark.
Bottle from Paul, Smells like sweet malt, copper. Dark brown pour, taste is malt, tiny roast in finish.
Bottle at Tokyo Dome Hotel. Dark brown colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel. Flavour is some caramel, malty.
Can in Room, Kooraku Hotel, Okayama. Clear black - white head. dry burned malty notes, roasted, chocolate, coffee, some berries, nutty notes, ok malty, some bisquit notes. OK.
